awd_abstract_narration: A precision mass spectrometer, sensitive enough to detect                  the ion cyclotron resonance frequency of a single trapped ion,                  will be used to measure the He/H mass ratio, providing an upper                 limit on the nest mass of the electron neutrino.  It should be                  possible to determine the mass of a gamma ray and thence the                    product of Planck's constant and Avagardro's number, also                       independently determining the fine structure constant in another                experiment trapped ion technology will be used to study collision               between atoms at energies below one millionth of the temperature                of most thermal atomic collision processes, providing                           understanding of spontaneous decay during the collisions and the                use of radiation to switch potential curves during collision
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
